page.title: 02COAL PRODUCTION
page.content: Eighty per cent of the production of coal from Creswell Colliery is taken by the power stations situated on the River Trent. It is used to generate electricity which is fed into the National Grid. The remainder of the coal is sold as household fuel. A train carrying 1,000 tonnes can be loaded with coal in one hour, the 30 tonne wagons being filled four at a time. Up to four of these merry-go-round trains leave Creswell each day, taking coal to the local power stations. Most of the household coal is transported by road. Methane gas is pumped out of the mine, mixed with air and used for firing a boiler. The hot water is used for the pit head baths and for heating the offices.
